description: {"blocks":[{"key":"dffm4","text":"Primary astrocytes were obtained from C57BL/6 mice embryonic day 17. The dissected cortical tissue was digested, triturated, and centrifuged. The cell pellet was resuspended in high-glucose DMEM/F12 supplemented with 10% FBS. Cells were seeded in poly-L-ornithine-coated Petri plates. Nonadherent cells were removed after 5-7 days. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it’s working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"3asq4","text":"For primary astrocyte culture - Use C57BL/6J mice at embryonic day 17 ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a0stu","text":"Anesthetized pregnant mice (1% sodium pentobarbital, 80mg/kg), dissect their embryos and collect the cortex. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5o0t3","text":"(Separate and remove the soft membrane and blood vessels, rinse the cerebral cortex in PBS, and use the ophthalmic scissor to cut pieces of the cortex)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"muhe","text":"Collect the cortices in PBS  in a 50 ml tube on ice","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fvf3b","text":"(The 50 ml tube contains 30 ml of PBS)   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":39,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"5E725EB18DED11ECA1850A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"","unit":165}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ff1ca","text":"Transfer the cortices to 15 ml tubes containing 1.5 ml trypsin–EDTA (0.25%) and incubate it at   for   Dissociate the cortices by triturating with a 10 mL serological pipette 10 – 15 times ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":95,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":101,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"","data":{"duration":900,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"695650578DED11ECA1850A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":false,"start":null,"temperature":"37","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"","data":{"duration":900,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"69564E098DED11ECA1850A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":false,"start":null,"temperature":"37","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cjmul","text":"Count the cells and plate them in a density of 50,000 cells/cm2 into PLL coated T-75 flask.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":62,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bqh8o","text":"After 3 h, change the culture medium once and check the growth and survival of cells under the microscope.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"co2a3","text":"Put the culture flask in a  -cell incubator for  ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":27,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":48,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"27c1","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"B72910508DED11ECA43E75AFAEC0CE9E","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"37","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":86400,"guid":"BCF4AD008DED11ECA43E75AFAEC0CE9E","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bf9ef","text":"Change the media after   and then every  . A confluent layer of the astrocytes grows at the bottom in 5-7 days followed by a top layer of microglia.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":23,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":40,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8d5ej","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":86400,"guid":"C7EFCD708DED11ECA43E75AFAEC0CE9E","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":259200,"guid":"CC3DCAD08DED11ECA43E75AFAEC0CE9E","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4q2d9","text":"After 5-7 days, put the flask on the shaker for 2 h at 200 rpm at 37℃ (incubator). Collect and discard the supernatant (consisting of microglia and some oligodendrocytes).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c9o47","text":"Wash the adherent cells with PBS and add 0.25% trypsin at 37℃ to detach the cells. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"pvmb","text":"Immediately add   DMEM medium containing 10% FBS","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":16,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"2qrg2","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"10","error":false,"guid":"2EBFFE308DEE11ECA43E75AFAEC0CE9E","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ef29m","text":"Centrifuge the cell suspension at   min for   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":34,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":44,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"421sk","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dqup","text":"Resuspend the cells in a T75 flask or 24 well plate with high glucose DMEM supplemented with 10% FBS.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9j674","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"centrifuge","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"centrifuge":"1500","duration":0,"error_centrifuge":false,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"488DD3F08DEE11ECA43E75AFAEC0CE9E","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":{"centrifuge":false,"temperature":false},"start":null,"temperature":"","temperatureUnit":10,"unit":33}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":300,"guid":"4C3E7FE08DEE11ECA43E75AFAEC0CE9E","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4ljep","text":"Identification of astrocytes by immunofluorescence staining: Use GFAP antibody (astrocytic marker) to identify the population of astroctes   ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"60od7","text":" Transduction with BRAF (Optional) ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":1,"length":22}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6t25m","text":"Astrocytes were transduced with BRAFV600E, or BRAFWT, or vector lentivirus plus 8 μg/ml polybrene for 24 h.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sup","offset":37,"length":4},{"style":"sup","offset":50,"length":2}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f0d24","text":"After transduction, the cells were cultured for 120 h in high-glucose DMEM/F12 (400ul/well) with or without FBS, and the medium as well as the cells were collected for subsequent experiments.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"1fm6b","text":"Triturate the cell suspension 10 times with a 1ml pipette","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Primary astrocyte culture
